help_tip: Rack or Plate Identifier
label: Rack or Plate Identifier

help_tip: Tube or Well Identifier
label: Tube or Well Identifier

help_tip: An identifier given to the Occurrence at the time it was recorded. Often serves as a link between field notes and an Occurrence record, such as a specimen collector's number.
label: Specimen Identifier

help_tip: The taxonomic Order into which the Family is placed.
label: Order or Group

help_tip: The taxonomic Family into which the Genus is placed.
label: Family

help_tip: The taxonomic Genus to which the Species belongs.
label: Genus

help_tip: A valid NCBI TAXON_ID to the species level is mandatory in order to submit data to public repositories.
label: Taxon Identifier

help_tip: The official scientific name as found in NCBI taxonomy database
label: Scientific Name

help_tip: Taxon remarks
label: Taxon Remarks

help_tip: Infraspecific epithet
label: Infraspecific Ephithet

help_tip: Culture or Strain ID
label: Culture or Strain Identifier

help_tip: Common name
label: Common Name

help_tip: e.g. Leg removed from complete organism
label: Organism Part

help_tip: Genome Acquisition Laboratory
label: GAL (Genome Acquisition Laboratory)

help_tip: Genome Acquisition Laboratory Sample ID
label: GAL (Genome Acquisition Laboratory) Sample Identifier

help_tip: Collector Sample ID
label: Collector Sample Identifier

help_tip: The name (or acronym) in use by the institution having custody of the object(s) or information referred to in the record.
label: Collector Affiliation

help_tip: Time of Collection
label: Time of Collection

help_tip: A list of geographic names less specific than the information captured in the Collection Site term. Starting with the least specific, add geograhic place names to identify location using the blue plus. E.g. U.K., London, Westminster, Westminster Abbey all as separate list entries.
label: Collection Location

help_tip: The geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic centre of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
label: Decimal Latitude

help_tip: The geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic centre of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
label: Decimal Longitude

help_tip: A list of maps, gazetteers, or other resources used to georeference the Location, described specifically enough to allow anyone in the future to use the same resources.
label: Grid Reference

help_tip: Comments or notes about the Location. e.g. Underwater since 2005
label: Habitat Remarks

help_tip: The original description of the depth below the local surface.
label: Depth (in metres)

help_tip: The original description of the elevation (altitude, usually above sea level) of the Location.
label: Elevation (in metres)

help_tip: The original geographic latitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic centre of a Location. Positive values are north of the Equator, negative values are south of it. Legal values lie between -90 and 90, inclusive.
label: Original Decimal Latitude

help_tip: The original geographic longitude (in decimal degrees, using the spatial reference system given in geodeticDatum) of the geographic centre of a Location. Positive values are east of the Greenwich Meridian, negative values are west of it. Legal values lie between -180 and 180, inclusive.
label: Original Decimal Longitude

help_tip: The name of, reference to, or description of the method or protocol used during an Event. E.g. UV light trap, mist net, bottom trawl, ad hoc observation, point count
label: Description of Collection Method

help_tip: Difficulty of sample re-collection. Quantify ie. 'guaranteed same day', 'several days searching', 'requires considerable effort' (offshore boat/Caving/remote location travel)
label: Difficult or High Priority Sample

help_tip: Separate multiple names with '|'
label: Identified By

help_tip: Separate multiple names with '|'
label: Identifier Affiliation

help_tip: Comment if chance of misidentification, reference text used to identify, etc
label: Species Determination Method

help_tip: Mixed sample risk
label: Mixed Sample Risk

help_tip: A list (concatenated and separated) of preparations and preservation methods for a specimen. Example, fossil, cast, photograph, DNA extract, skin, skull, skeleton, whole animal (ETOH), tissue (EDTA)
label: Preserved By

help_tip: A list of affiliations separated by '|'
label: Preserver Affiliation

help_tip: Preparations and preservation methods for a specimen
label: Preservation Approach

help_tip: Specific preservative solution used in preparation
label: Preservative Solution

help_tip: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. In format YYYY-MM-DD
label: Time Elapsed from Collection to Preservation (in hours)

help_tip: The date-time or interval during which an Event occurred. For occurrences, this is the date-time when the event was recorded. Not suitable for a time in a geological context. In format YYYY-MM-DD
label: Date of Preservation
Barcode Hub

label: Tube or Well Identifier for Barcoding

help_tip: Barcoding Status
label: Barcoding Status

help_tip: Field for recording the accession number for the barcoding data for this sample once submitted to BOLD
label: Bold Accession Number

help_tip: Proxy voucher ID
label: Proxy Voucher Identifier

help_tip: Voucher Link
label: Voucher Link

help_tip: Proxy voucher Link
label: Proxy Voucher Link

help_tip: Voucher Institution
label: Voucher Institution

help_tip: Sample format
label: Sample Format

live biological sample from infectious organism
